name: Redesigned GUI, Proxgrind RevG device support, and new features
UID modification commands bugs fixed
body:
This should fix most of the reported crashes from the Google Play Store developer console. The Google ``FirebaseCrash`` packages are also included to help the developer catalog and better log the oddball exceptions that happen on some weird combinations of Android devices that can't be identified with my testing. As usual, the free version of the APK (signed with the same Play Store developer key) can be downloaded from the link below for those who are too paranoid :smile: to install a re-packaged Google APK binary, but do not want the hassle of performing a lengthy code audit of this repository. 

Enjoy, and please do [let me know](https://github.com/maxieds/ChameleonMiniLiveDebugger/issues) if there are persistent problems in your regular use of the application. Simply sending the crash or ANR report data through the Google-only channel is surprisingly uninformative alone!

Users who want to contribute to the project without having me pull request their code contributions are always welcome to see the [new sponsorship link](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.maxieds.chameleonminilivedebugger.paid) button. I am also always in need of extra Chameleon hardware and/or a decent used/new Proxmark device if you really appreciate the app.

name: Stability updates and bug fixes to the CRASH / ANR reports on Play Store
body:
This should fix most of the reported crashes from the Google Play Store developer console. The Google ``FirebaseCrash`` packages are also included to help the developer catalog and better log the oddball exceptions that happen on some weird combinations of Android devices that can't be identified with my testing. As usual, the free version of the APK (signed with the same Play Store developer key) can be downloaded from the link below for those who are too paranoid :smile: to install a re-packaged Google APK binary, but do not want the hassle of performing a lengthy code audit of this repository. 

Enjoy, and please do [let me know](https://github.com/maxieds/ChameleonMiniLiveDebugger/issues) if there are persistent problems in your regular use of the application. Simply sending the crash or ANR report data through the Google-only channel is surprisingly uninformative alone!

Users who want to contribute to the project without having me pull request their code contributions are always welcome to see the [new sponsorship link](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.maxieds.chameleonminilivedebugger.paid) button. I am also always in need of extra Chameleon hardware and/or a decent used/new Proxmark device if you really appreciate the app.

name: Updates to LIVE logging and incremental bug fixes
body:
The following former bugs are fixed in this new release:
* The set *RANDOM UID* function now works completely and does not change the toolbar contents when run.
* The printing of *LIVE* logs is now re-enabled for sure. 
* APDU send commands: Updated *SEND*/*SEND_RAW* to use full byte strings instead of parsing the output to send byte-by-byte.

name: Now parsing the new Chameleon Rev. G firmware sniffer logging codes
body:
This update fixes the inconsistencies mentioned [here (#185)]() on the Chameleon Mini (Rev. G) firmware issues discussion board. In particular, it adds recognition for the new logging codes found [here](https://github.com/emsec/ChameleonMini/blob/master/Firmware/Chameleon-Mini/Log.h#L26): *LOG_INFO_CODEC_SNI_READER_DATA*, *LOG_INFO_CODEC_SNI_READER_DATA_W_PARITY*, *LOG_INFO_CODEC_SNI_CARD_DATA*, and *LOG_INFO_CODEC_SNI_CARD_DATA_W_PARITY*. Given that the sniffer mode in the Chameleon Mini firmware now distinguishes **bidirectional** logging data, the direction data (previously denoted by *<-->*, in image form) is now correctly reported in the live logs. 

**New / interested users, please test and give me feedback on the new version of the app which will be pushed to Play Store just shortly!**

name: Now rocking in the prime world with build number 53
body: A few incremental improvements have been introduced (see the Git commit logs). This re-release is mostly just a forced update by the Google who made some determination that the app was collecting information about device advertising IDs. As such a [user privacy policy](https://github.com/maxieds/ChameleonMiniLiveDebugger/wiki/UserPrivacyPolicy) has been installed on the WIKI site. I believe that the policy serves to clarify my stance on what data is aggregated by the app -- which is to say that user data is not collected whatsoever. Concerned users who want more information about the alleged breach of their privacy can read the email ultimatum I was sent this week by a no-reply address at Google. Believe me I would take more issue with Google on this than most users probably would from a violation of my builds like this. Any questions there can be directed at my inbox. On a brighter note, the build number for this release has been updated to reflect the changes. We are now a prime number and should stay that way for the foreseeable future. As a special gift for the users of lucky number 53(!!) the free version will include a new lightening theme (screenshot attached below). ![v53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22165688/45854839-2d811100-bd1b-11e8-93fc-037181217259.png)

name: Better RevE Support
body: Better support for RevE board configurations (configmy=). Added a help dialog button to the top of the app. Verified RevE support now works with my newly arrived board.

name: Added CLONE Command and Minor Bug Fixes
body: Also added nicer looking graphics for the threshold signal bars, a CONFIG=? button and a STORE button to the Tools menu, markers at the top of the app to denote REVE/REVG boards, and misc other formatting changes.

name: More Bug Fixes and Auto-Scrolling
body: Fixed errors running DUMP_MFU and added warnings about needing to be in reader mode to send APDU commands to the output. Added auto-scrolling to the logging tab when there is a new metadata record added to the logs (i.e., command output).

name: Bug Fixes
body: Pushed this release out the door to fix a critical bug setting the timeout on the Chameleon boards which was causing the app to freeze on startup. More testing to come. RevE support should be verified soon.

name: Bug Fixes and New Features
body:
Fixed many of the crashes in the Play Store ANR report. Added LAST_UID button. Updated display of threshold signal strength bars at top of the app.

**Update:** This release has apparently broken support for both the RevE and RevG devices. I will not be able to fix this for a couple of days unfortunately. I have uploaded the original v0.3.6 APK for backwards support until I am able to fix the issues in the updated code.

name: Common Bug / Crash Fixes
body: Attempts to fix many of the common crashes in the Play Store ANR report.

name: More RevE Rebooted Device Support
body: Integrated the RevE Rebooted commands listed [here](https://github.com/iceman1001/ChameleonMini-rebooted/wiki/Terminal-Commands) into the app. Hopefully this does not break anything for the RevG users. Please contact the developer immediately at [this email](mailto:maxieds@gmail.com) if it does :) Signed APK file uploaded as usual.

name: RevE Rebooted Device Support
body: Added USB support for RevE devices. This release also contains the former beta release new features: new themes, new APDU communication tab, and new export options. Please contact the developer immediately if there are any problems with the new release!

name: APDU Commands Tab Fully Functional (Beta Release)
APDU Commands Tab
body: A work in progress, but this is officially a pre-release for beta testing. Will officially be added to the Play Store repos for beta testing.

name: Upgrades and Bug Fixes
body: This release adds a number of features. It includes several of the stock tag dump images within the app that can easily be uploaded at runtime. I added pretty printing of the output of DUMP_MFU (to add cloning capabilities shortly -- currently in testing mode). Fixed the themes menu not working on Oreo 8.1 and added many new themes to the free release.

name: Stability fixes
body:
The paid flavor of the app is available on Play Store for approximately $5 [here](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.maxieds.chameleonminilivedebugger.paid). If you want to contribute a small amount to the development of this app, or find it particularly useful and would like to add to the developer's "good scotch" jar, please install this non-free open sourced version on your device. 

The key features are still the same as in the vanilla free release version posted below (this will not change). I added more of the bonus themes from the paid flavor to the free flavor in this release. Notably check out "Redmond" and the "Red" and "White" themes aimed to color-coordinate with the colored boards available for the Chameleon Mini. Email the developer if you have any additional reasonable requests for themes that should be built-in to the free version. 

Enjoy!

name: New themes added to free release flavor
body:
The paid flavor of the app is available on Play Store for approximately $5 [here](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.maxieds.chameleonminilivedebugger.paid). If you want to contribute a small amount to the development of this app, or find it particularly useful and would like to add to the developer's "good scotch" jar, please install this non-free open sourced version on your device. 

The key features are still the same as in the vanilla free release version posted below (this will not change). I added more of the bonus themes from the paid flavor to the free flavor in this release. Notably check out "Redmond" and the "Red" and "White" themes aimed to color-coordinate with the colored boards available for the Chameleon Mini. Email the developer if you have any additional reasonable requests for themes that should be built-in to the free version. 

Enjoy!

name: New features added
body: Added search functionality tab with many options, fabric/IO plugin support for debugging releases, new UID changing features, and a number of bug fixes.

name: Current release
body: Bug fixes and new themes. Card upload feature via XModem seems to have some bugs, though the transfers go through smoothly. New app icon and imagery.

name: Themes for free version
body: Added a few themes to the free version of the app at the request of @gtpy. Last selected theme is now stored in SharedPreferences and reloaded the next time the app launches.

name: Stable application with flavors
body: This release adds a few buttons to the tools menu and includes some bug fixes, mostly from integration with the new themes in the "paid" flavor release available on [Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.maxieds.chameleonminilivedebugger.paid). The individual themes from the previous release are now wrapped up into the "paid" flavor which can be obtained for a nominal entry fee to support future development of the project. See the screenshots for the "paid" flavor on the [Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.maxieds.chameleonminilivedebugger.paid) and in Issue #7.

name: Stable release with themes
body: Stability improvements and bug fixes. Added a status bar icon for the application when it is in the foreground. Added several stylized color themes (flavors) to the source.

name: Stable application
body: Stability improvements and bug fixes. Small changes to the UI to make it more usable.

name: Stable mostly functional application
body: Major reorganization of the tools menus. Also some very noticeable stability and reliability bug fixes to the app for USB connections (plug and play). New ActionBar features a summary of the connected device properties. Separated global from reader command lists for clarity. New slider / toggle buttons for READONLY,FIELD=0/1. Labels for the peripheral spinners, status icons for usb / new messages / new logs / etc. XModem downloads of logs and slot cards now functional. If you haven't tried it, or felt the previous development releases were too buggy try it out again!
